newsitem.title: CHILE: Endesa to invest $1.9 bln in Chile, Latam.
newsitem.headline: Endesa to invest $1.9 bln in Chile, Latam.

text.p: Chile's top power generator Endesa will invest $1.9 billion over the next seven years in projects in Chile and the rest of Latin America, said president Jose Yuraszeck.
"The investments will allow Endesa to double its current level of production over the next seven years and (achieve) an important presence in Latin America," Yuraszeck told a shareholders' meeting.
The company already generates more electricity outside Chile than within the country, he added.
The Chilean schemes include six new power plants, three in the central grid and three in the north of the country to power the region's fast-growing mining industry.
The utility also plans to expand its transmission systems and build two pipelines to supply central and northern Chile with natural gas from Argentina, he said.
Endesa already generates 16 percent of Argentina's electricity, 24 percent of Peru's power supplies and five percent of Colombia's power.
